Brilliant day trip to Ourika valley. We decided to do the day tour to Ourika valley with Morocco inspiring tours. We had the best day, with lots of wonderful impressions. As if visiting a women's argan oil cooperative, hiking the mountains, seeing the waterfalls, lunch by the river and visiting a Berber family wasn't enough, Abdul also took us to a pottery manufacturer. In his workshop and shop I got to have a go at throwing a clay bowl on the pottery wheel. We also purchased all of our pottery at this fantastic workshop. Abdul is an excellent guide and we got to learn so much about not only the places that we visited but also about the country itself. All in all, a fabulous day away from the busy city of Marrakech.
4 day desert trip Marrakech to Fes. Abdul was a great driver and he took us to lots of interesting places on our 4 day trip to the desert. We had a great time and the experience was unforgettable.
Amazing Sahara Trip. Abdul took great care of us as he drove myself and three friends from Marrakech to the sahara and then on to fez.

Fantastic Trip. Me and my friends did a four night excursion to the desert. It was a fantastic trip that I would recommend to anyone. The car was comfy and clean, our driver was friendly and stopped along the way at lookouts so we could take photos. The trip was a good price and I would do it again

Many varied and reasonable priced trips, with excellent guide too!. We took 3 trips in total, a local tour of Marrakesh sites, a trip out into the desert to see the Berber villages and also a trip to Essaouira on the coast. Abdul took care of us, made sure we knew where to go and what to see to make the most of our time. There was also many longer trips on offer all equally well thought out, planned and priced. Abdul himself is knowledgeable, speaks good english and made the long drives a pleasure. All round the highest recommendation I can give, I really felt we made the right choice.

Family Visit to Marrakech. We visited Marrakech for nearly 2 weeks in August this year. Our guide Abdul was an excellent tour guide, he accompanied my family and I throughout our stay there. A great highlight was our day trip to the Atlas Mountains which included camel rides, a visit to a Berber household and of course hiking the mountain. I thoroughly recommend Abdul, he is super attentive and friendly, most definitely made our trip that more special.

A great trip and hike into the Ourika Valley. Abdul is a great driver. Attentive and keen to chat about his country. He drove us to the scenic Ourika valley at the foot of the Atlas mountains, which offered a great break from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.Along the way we stopped a few times to visit places of interest and take a few memorable photos (crossing the "scary bridge", as Abdul calls it). Once we arrived at our destination, he introduced us to a local guide with whom we hiked up to the waterfalls, and back down through the red hills in time for lunch at one of the riverside restaurants. A brilliant day out.I would definitely travel with Abdul again. He is a skilled driver and a trustworthy guide.

Sahara trip Morocco. We visited marrakech during Christmas holidays with 3 young children (all under 11). The trip was organised by Abdul and was very easy and accommodating keeping children in my mind. Abdul spoke very good English and came acorss very humble, softly spoken and honest. We did not feel any insecure at all during the whole trip. Ah ! Abdul rahman s driving is very very safe - matter of fact we crossed the Atlas mountain at around 11 pm ( atlas mountain is a single lane road and known as notorious in morocco) again we did not feel any discomfort during his driving. I must admit at times he drives on 60km/h (about 50mp/h on a clear motorway . Morrocon speed limit is 60km/h) but this is to maintain the fuel economy and to avoid police fines- which is understandable. In summary I would use Abdul for my next trip and strongly recommend his services to all especially to families with children

visit to marrakesh, sahara and many places in morrocco. i am saj from England. i visited Morocco in July-august 15'. i got very nice and friendly guide in Marrakesh, his name abdul rehman. he is very honest and friendly with my all family, he is driver but he provide all information which is very helpful to me and my family. my son is really enjoy with him. he knows all history and all new and old places so we got real life history from him. very nice car as well.he gave us right advised. very price wise reasonable , knowledgeable and gave interesting real stories . really i like tour with him. i will go again and i will use again.

Great guide. Good guy to travel with. Whenever you want to stop to take a picture he is there ready to help you. Even when you need to talk to someone who doesn't speak your language he's there to help you understand each other.

Amazing day with Abdul!!! Must do!. Abdul was the best tour guide! We had a great day filled with laughs, interesting stories, and sharing music with each other. I was picked up by Abdul in the morning and we left Marrakech for a full day of sightseeing. I am a film buff and Abdul was happy to take me to Atlas Film Studio where many Hollywood productions were filmed. The drive was lovely through the Atlas mountains and we even made a stop on the road where they'd just shot the motorcycle scenes from Mission Impossible 5. Abdul was very happy to take pictures of me in front of various landmarks. We talked about music and he very much enjoyed listening to some of my favorite American songs. We had a blast singing and sharing stories about our respective cultures. I learned so much about the Muslim culture and the holiday of Ramadan. And although he wasn't able to join me while I ate lunch, he took me to a great kasbah near Ait Bennhadou. I told him how much time I needed to explore the area and he took pictures and gave me great tips on how to explore the area. We drove back to Marrakech and continued to share stories. Before he took me back to my hotel, he took me to a great place to ride a camel. I had told him that I'd like to ride a camel before leaving and it was certainly a highlight of the day. I had such a fun day with Abdul... don't miss your chance to have a wonderful guided tour and learn so much more about Morocco!

Excellent, a book of knowledge, Highly recommended!. We did a day tour of Marrakech with Youssef, he was wonderful! The tour was well organised, his English was great and had lots of information to share about the sights we visited. We visited sights we otherwise might not have visited and he was happy to amend the schedule if we wanted to change it.We would highly recommend Youssef as a Marrakech guide....Thank you for sharing your city with us!

Highly recommend Youssef. We hired Youssef for our tour guide for a day and one half in Marakesh and were very pleased. He was very prompt and had a plan in mind although we could change it if we had wanted to do so. His English is perfect and his knowledge of Moroccan history and the sights we were seeing was excellent. He provided us with a very pleasant stay in Marakech and we highly recommend him.

Hire hire for the day!. Youssef arrived promptly at our Riad and provided an excellent day tour for our group of 4. We loved that he had arranged a vehicle to take us out of the Medina for a few sites, as well as a walking tour the remainder of the afternoon. Felt that it was very well prepared and he was able to share lots of information and answer our endless questions! He has a passion for this city and it really shows in his work. Would gladly recommend (or rebook again if in Marrakech)

Great experience!. We were guided by Youseff and enjoyed everything minute of it. We asked him to take us around the places you won't see as a tourist on your own and so he did. He told us a lot about the Marrocan people as well as about the typical things of Marrakech. We can recommend him without any hesitation

Excellent day! . Went with my partner earlier this September for 4 days before we both went back to university. We wanted to do a guided tour of the city because because we didn't have long. Youseff gave us a detailed tour around many different locations spread across the city. He gave such detailed information without it being long winded, everything he said we were totally engrossed. I particularly appreciated the way he educated us about religion and its place in Moroccan culture. It opened a completely new perspective on how I saw Marrakech! Definitely recommend doing this tour at the beginning of your trip, as he gives lots of useful tips on staying safe and finding your way around.. Particularly because he collects and drops you off at your Riad. Overall a lovely day and felt like we were in the best hands as we toured the city.

Private tour. Youssef was a great tour guide for my wife and I. Excellent English, very personable, and extremely knowledgeable about Marrakech (been doing it several years). He also arranged and recommended excursions outside of Marrakech that were very good and reasonable. He is highly recommended.

Best possible way to get familar with Marrakech. We have booked Youssef for a full-day tour of Marrakech for our first day. All correspondence was perfect via email, he collected us on time at the reception of our hotel. We were chauffeured in a very comfortable car to our first destinations around town in the morning before we walked through the souks of Medina in the afternoon. In the morning we were taken to several of the main attractions of Marrakech before Youssef brought us to the roof terrace Riad Omar where we basically had private lunch overviewing Medina. In the afternoon we were taken on a tour of the old Medina by foot and especially the famous souks. We were shown various hidden places from the local bakeries, hamams and many other intriguing details of this historical city. We had an amazing, educational and thrilling day with Youssef and his knowledge and love for sharing information about Morocco and Marrakech was priceless to get an appreciation on your first day.

Highly recommended!. We went on the half day souks and medina tour with Youssef when we arrived in Marrakech. I highly recommend touring with him on your first day (though anytime would be fine). He taught us so much to help us enjoy the rest of our stay. He helped us learn how to get to the main square and souks from our riad, lots of history, pointed out places to visit on our own later, tips for staying safe and how to be less overwhelmed. He answered lots of questions. The souks really are a maze and we enjoyed looking at many different areas including the leather and blacksmith areas. We left at 11am and I was nervous based on another review that we would miss things by not going in the morning. Turns out the timing was fine. I didn't notice anything being closed and as I mentioned earlier I'm so glad we toured with Youssef as our first activity. We would have been very overwhelmed the first day (and possibly the whole trip) without all of the advice we received from Youssef.

Amazing guide.. You will need someone to help you navigate the maze like streets of the medina and Youssef will greet you with a smile and fill you in on all the relevant culture and history. We highly recommend choosing him as your guide if you plan to visit Morocco.

great guided tour. Just came back from a privat guided tour in Marrakech with our guide Youssef Kharroubi.it was a magnificent day out, partly with a nice car, and partly walking.we learned a lot of "the real" Islam and the way of live of the people of Marrakech. He was very informative and took us to non touristic sites in the souks, he recommended a restaurant were we had a nice tagine lunch.We visited several places like the Yves Saint Laurant gardens, the Bahia palace, the Saadian graves...the souks.Thank you Youssef for beiing our guide.

Great visit to the insides of Marrakech. I had a very short time in Marrakech so I booked the full day tour with Youssef.He was born there and he can really explain everything you need to know and more.We visited everything that you must see and the walk trough the Zouk ,can not be described,having Youssef as a guide,you can feel and understand how people really lives,their way if thinking and how is their real life !!!Don't miss it!!!!

Private tour . We asked Youseff for a private tour and he didn't disappoint. From the initial enquiry he was helpful and tailored the tour to our requirements. We stared that we didn't want any shopping but a history tour of the Medina. Youseff demonstrated his excellent knowledge, giving us a real insight into culture and modern history of both Marrakech & Morocco as a whole (our son had already done a history tour the week before that had covered the ancient history). He took us through the maze of souks and alleys that we would never have found ourselves enlightening us with stories & facts as we went. Well worth the money.

A Wonderful Guide. Youseff is a very knowledgeable and genuine person. First thing in the morning Youseff asked us what we wanted to see and what we did not want to see. He was right on with our requests and the arrangement with having an air-conditioned van for my wife and I to see the sites of Marrakech was relaxing and efficient. We felt that he was truly talking with us about life in Marrakech and we learned a lot of amazing behind the scenes facts and tidbits about everyday life. After having a guide in Fes, which we thought was great, made us realize what a amazing guide Youseff is and how lucky we were to have him for the day.

A very reliable guide in Marrakech. From the moment I emailed,Youssef Kharroubi replied so quickly, and there were a lot of questions concerning the tour . The guide and his driver showed up as promised at the right time and drove us through the city . Kharroubi was very knowledgeble and could answer all our questions. His English is excellent and he paced the day well. . There is so much to see in each of the locations we visited.Our trip ,in general , was very good and very memorable.I will surely recommend MarrakechTour guide and Youssef Kharroubi as a tourist guide when tourists look for a tour company.higly recommended

Poor arrangement. Could have been more enjoyable with the right guide.. I haven't written any reviews for a long time but I feel that I should write this one. I have read an overwhelming number of excellent reviews on Tripadvisor about different private tour operators in Marrakech, I simply am not happy with my own experience. I contacted Marrakech Tour Guide for a half-day trip in the afternoon with Youssef. Early in the morning of the trip I got an email from Youssef saying he had to cancel due to back pain. He would send his friend instead. I was suspicious but with such short notice I didn't have many choices and so I agreed to hire his friend. We got to the hotel around 3 pm and on the way from the airport to the hotel I noticed it wasn't very happening in the medina probably due to the heat. So when I saw our guide, I asked if it was a good time to visit the medina in the afternoon. He said we had booked the trip already and even if we canceled, we would have to pay and that's the way it worked. I wasn't going to cancel the trip but would like to see if there were other alternative activities he would recommend. So showing us his only concern was just about money didn't leave a good impression. We started our medina and the souk tour at 3:30. We went to a university, walked around the medina and the souk. I wish we came in the morning instead as many shops were closed. For example when we went to the communal bakery, it was almost closed and was empty, so we couldn't experience the local crowd coming to have their bread made. We didn't get to see the sheep auction in the morning either. I asked to see the tanneries but the guide told me that they were closed. I, however, found out later that the tanneries were open in the afternoon too. We could have gone and I was disappointed. I would strongly recommend a tour in the morning if you have a choice. I did ask before I booked if afternoon was happening in the medina but didn't have any reply. The guide took us to a silversmith in the medina. He made good locks. However I wasn't ready to pay 50-60 euros for some heavy super-size lock as a home decoration. The guide tried to sell them to me and said these were the people that I wanted to HELP. They were over-priced. Then the guide took us to a wood shop. The shop owner wanted to sell me a small wooden toy box in which a snake popped out when one opened it. It was cute but I wasn't interested. He started first at €15 each, then €20 for two and I wasn't interested and walked out of the shop. Then the guide called me back and asked how much I wanted to pay. I told them I was not interested and the owner offers them at two for € 15. I was firm and told them I simply didn't want any. Then the guide let go and grabbed a couple of small toy horse figures for my children to make up for his pushiness. I traveled with my 7 and 5 years old boys. The guide didn't engage them. Unlike what I read on Trip Advisor about how guides are great at interacting with children. There was hardly any interactions between this guide and my children. They were bored and wanted to go back to the hotel. I asked to take them for ice cream then. Overall, this guide is just below average. (1) show more concern about money than how to tailor-made a good tour for this customers. (2) pushing us hard to buy in his friends' shops. (3) not good at interacting with young children. (4) Not good at reading people. When we wanted to spend more time at the snake charmers, he was rushing us to go. He just failed to deliver although he repeated a couple of times " You see, I am trying very hard."Youssef did call before and after the tour to check how things went. It unfortunately didn't my experience.

The perfect guide for Marrakech. This is a great way to see Marrakech and its surrounding . Our guide Kharroubi had a wonderful personality and showed us everything that could possibly be seen. By using a private guide, you can see a lot ,escape the crowds and see other beautiful sights that normally a large group could not. Youssef was very responsive in pacing the tour with what we wanted to do; we could ask to take photos and "chill," at any time during the tour. What makes this the ideal tour is the attention to details; Youssef Kharroubi and his driver treat you as if you are their family, which creates a very welcoming atmosphere.We can t wait to return to Morocco for another trip.Highly recomended

Incredible introduction for our first visit to Morocco. Our day started with Youssef meeting us at our Riad to escort us to the car for the first half of the tour, "palaces and monuments." At each stop, Youssef accompanied us and provided a wealth of information site, as well as vast amounts of information of Moroccan and Muslim culture that we would have never learned elsewhere. He gave generous time for pictures, especially at the Jardin Majorelle, my favorite stop. The next three stops, Bahia Palace, Koutoibia Mosque, and Saadiens Tombs, took us through centuries of Moroccan history, politics, culture, and architecture. After a few hours of the tour, Youssef led us to a luncheon at a place with quite possibly the most scenic panorama of the city. Per Youssef's suggestion, we ate the chicken and lemon tangine which filled us up for our dive into the souks! The first half of the tour would have been difficult with Youssef's help, but the remainder would have been impossible. He navigates his way through the twisting and curving medieval medina as though he's walking through an open filed. What's even more amazing is that he does not meet a stranger. Following Youssef, we began to truly appreciate the "organized chaos" of Marrakech! We commenced our souk tour buy visiting a Moroccan pharmacy of sorts where we were given a short demonstration about Argan oils and other healing herbs and spices. With Youssef, you do not have to bargain, and he ensures you are getting the best quality and service. We also visited a lantern store, shoe store, and a store for tea sets with similar experiences. In fact, after leaving one store, I realized I'd made an accidental purchase. Not to worry with Youssef! He calmly returned to the store and everything was worked out! Finally, we visited the rug cooperation. There, we had an intriguing demonstration of the various regions of Morocco and the types of rugs made there. Again, Youssef ensures that you are getting the best price and quality. After the rug shop, our day with Youssef was nearing its end. He escorted us back to the Riad and even showed us a few surprises along the way only a true Marrakecki could spot. We hated to say goodbye to our new Marrakechi friend, Youssef. My brother and I both agreed we would have enjoyed his company and knowledge for our entire journey. I've done many similar tours across the world, and this one was one of the very best! Youssef's knowledge of the city, great personality, and savvy shopping skills in the souks make him an indispensable guide. If you want an unforgettable time in Morocco, contact Youssef! You will not regret it! I look forward to his help in my future visits to his lovely country!

See Marrakech with a local resident and tour guide. We often hire a tour guide to show us around when we travel and especially when time is limited. To be shown around by a local resident is the perfect way to see locations which visitors may not discover on their own or wouldn't have access to. Our 3 day visit o Marrakech was tightly packed and a guide was needed.Youssef is mentioned often on Tripadvisor as THE guide to book. We e mailed Youssef for availability and he responded within 24 hours. He was clear about his fee and time booked , and answered a couple of questions. We were confident about all arrangements made.Youssef collected us in a car from the Pullman Resort at the time agreed. He gave us the benefit of his wide knowledge of Marrakech places, people, politics, Monarchy and more and our questions were answered in perfect English. We were taken to a rooftop restaurant at midday. It was a place we would never have found left to our own devices. Unfortunately Youssef did not join us as it was Ramadam. His driver with an air conditioned 4x4 confidently negotiated the narrow streets in the Medina Old Town, without a problem and was waiting for us after we had seen each attraction. This was very welcome as the temperature was 34deg C plus. I also find walking distances exhausting and Youssef regularly asked was I ok.We would recommend this likeable man as an excellent tour guide. Don't delay to contact him as he is a very busy man. See my photos for his details.

Great experience with excellent tour guide. Youssef is very a professional and knowledgeable guide who knows all the places of interest and so many local people. He is ver effective communicator who speaks perfect English. He took us to historical and culture tours. We felt safe, enjoyed and learned a lot.

Youssef - very best in town. Our tour with Yousseff was in one word brillant. Youssef is an intellegent man who spoke fluently English. We really liked the insites he gave on the city and its people. A must do!

An Exciting Tour!. Yousseff was very knowledgeable and fun, its is easy to contact him and he respond quite promptly. Our accommodation was quite far from the medina however Yousseff was happily to arrange transportation for us for the 6 hours city tour. We visited Marrakesh in Ramadhan, and as we were also fasting, Yousseff was very understanding to care for us by not tiring us too much. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed the tour given by Yousseff, not only its very informative but having him as our tour guide make us feel safe and not be clueless is the big Marrakesh city. Thank you for the great experience!

Tour guide was a no-show. Not trustworthy.. We e-mailed Youssef multiple times and booked our tour four weeks in advance. The day of the tour, he did not show up at our riad. Not knowing his number, we asked to check e-mail at the riad. There was an e-mail from Youssef sent the night before asking us to confirm. Since we didn't confirm, he didn't show up. He sent an apology e-mail saying he waited "so long" for our reply that he booked another tour. He sent the e-mail 16 hours before the morning tour! We were on vacation and Marrakech does not have wifi in that many places, how were we supposed respond in such a short time frame? Youssef had the name of the riad we were staying, if he was so concerned, why didn't he call? Of course, he was more than happy to reschedule with us a couple days later.Terribly irresponsible behavior. Wasting much of our time before and after the trip. There are plenty of tour guides in the area. You can find a good one for less money through your riad or hotel.

Comprehensive Marrakech Tour. We really enjoyed our tour with Youssef. He is very polite, attentive and showed broad knowledge about the touristic sites. He took us to expected and unexpected places (like the collective bakery inside the souk) and gave us interesting details about the sites we visited. During our tour we visited Koutobia Mosque, Bahia Palace, Saadian Tombs, Jardin Majorelle,The Madrassa, the souks and Jemma El Fna Square. In just one day we had a complete view of the city.

Youssef was fantastic. Youssef guided our group around as part of our Topdeck tour. We learned a lot about Marrakech and Morocco itself, having only just flown in to the country the day before. We visited the Saadin tombs, the Bahia palace, walked up some side streets and ended at a restaurant next to the square. I'm glad we had a tour guide as I would have had no idea what any of the attractions were about! Youssef's English was great and it really helped us out.

Great guided tour through Marrakech. We were in town just for a few days and wanted to make the most of our trip, so we hired Youssef to help show us around. It was a bit of a whirlwind tour as we tried perhaps to pack in too many sights, but he and his driver accommodated us. He speaks several languages fluently and helped provide a lot of colorful background to our trip. He and his driver were always on-time for pick ups. All around, a great trip...we will plan a longer stay next time.One thing to note is before you leave for your guided tour, make sure to ask for an estimate of how much to bring to pay entrance fees as many of the sites don't accept credit cards and I found myself hunting an ATM.

Great tour of Marrakesh . We spent two days with Youssef. He is incredibly knowledgeable, super friendly and provides an incredible tour. The souks can be overwhelming, it was great to have a guide that knows the winding streets like the back of his hand. We had three small children with us and Youssef kept the tour moving so the kids didn't get bored. I would highly recommend Youssef to anyone who is looking to learn about Marrakesh.

A wonderful guide who goes above and beyond the expected.. We hired Youssef for 2 half day tours when we first arrived in Marrakech. I am so glad we did as not only did he provide excellent tours of the many sites and Medina, but he was incredibly helpful in making other arrangements for us as well. More on that in a minute. On the day of our tour Youseff met us on time at our Riad and took us through the Medina explaining the history of the city as well as educating us on larger cultural dynamics of Morocco. His historic and contemporary knowledge of Marrakech and Morocco was thorough and enlightening. He is well known throughout the Medina and you will not be bothered by anyone while in his company. He had his own driver who would whisk us to our next location with great efficiency. When our tour was over he would leave us at a restaurant I had chosen and made sure to give us very good directions back to our Riad. Having spent the morning together he had learned of some of our other plans for our visit and offered to help arrange transportation for us to the restaurants and bars we were planning on visiting. This relieved us of the need to engage in the horrible haggling and rip-off schemes of the local taxi drivers. Sure we paid a bit more to get around ($10 each way vs. $5) but our drivers had nice cars and would call ahead to our Riad so we were met and never go lost. So worth it. Youseff is a great tour guide and a good person to know during your visit to Marrakech and I recommend him thoroughly.

Fantastic! . I am in Morocco with a colleague following a work trip, and we were lucky enough to read the great reviews for Youssef. He arrived on time, was very smart, funny and friendly! He knows everyone in Marrakech. They all greet him with warmth and respect. He is so knowledgeable, which makes sense, as he is also a teacher. He gave us great insight to the cultures, religions, and communities of the area. He was very patient with us (we take a ton of photos) and made sure to take us to the best places for the particular items we wanted to buy. I told him walking with him in the souks is like walking with the godfather because you can walk in peace, none of the shop owners hassle you with him around. It was worth the money just for that, but the tour was better than I could have hoped for and he is a very smart and friendly delight. We were so pleased, we couldn't say no when he asked if he could help arrange a trip to the Atlas Mountains for today, and that was great too!

I disliked this tour, very expensive yet he asked us to tip everyone and made us pay to enter Jardin Majorelle.. They came to our hotel to arrange the tour, not telling us it was private until the last minute. He wouldn't stop for us to take photos, he wouldn't stop for me to buy anything unless it was at very expensive 'shops' in the medina that 'he' chose and where I didn't want to be. The idea of 'tours', is not pressure to buy, take note please..... Seeing the rug being hand made was nice, but the next half hour being shown rugs and totally ignored that we 'didn't want' to buy one was annoying! This was a main theme! Reminiscent of the tuk tuk tours from hell in Thailand where they take you where THEY want you to go and refuse to go where YOU wish.... Being told to tip everyone and having to pay for the Jardin Majorelle, when we'd paid 75 euros for the tour, each! Was on the nose... The fish in the muddy damn, ho hum, not a tourist Mecca. Trying to convince me to buy expensive argan oil, when you find a local food shop and buy it very reasonablely priced .... Too much time where we didn't want to be, waiting at the exits for him for far too long, then rushed through the areas we found of interest. I wouldn't recommend this. We also noted other guides doing the exact same thing, other people being led to where they didn't wish to be and their guides refusing to stop when asked. We shouldn't have to risk getting lost when stopping to take a photo because the tour guide won't stop for you! We saw the palace, but far too much detail. Waiting for the car in the heat when finished wasn't pleasant at some sites either... It didn't wait most times. The lunch was the one standout, FANTASTIC, total luxury, but it was tinged by the deep sadness I felt on seeing the way the poor and the animals are mistreated while being walked through. Beggars selling discarded shoes, skeletal humans, almost right outside this amazing Persian restaurant, like being inside a palace itself.... The musicians inside exotic, mountain people in traditional costume, the music eerie and the type of foreign we're here to see.... the food fantastic the atmosphere so plush, then starving people outside, I wanted to invite them in.... This tour was total frustration....

A Half-Day of Knowledge, Wisdom and Brotherhood with Youseff. While visiting Marrakesh in April, my boutique hotel Zar Daman, booked Yourself to take me on a half-day walking tour of Marrakesh! I can't thank Yourself enough for his hospitality, warmth, and honesty as we walked and talked and shared across continents, countries, cultures, and religions. I would highly recommend him for your tour guide and feel like I made a friend...in the process.

Great Guide. Yousseff was a very good guide. Very professional and well-spoken. We had a half-day with him in the Medina, and it really helped us to get acclimated to the city. I felt much more comfortable there after our tour than I did before it. He took us to look at carpets. I knew that he was probably getting a commission on it, but I enjoyed the experience and absolutely love the rug that I bought. It was a very nice, high-quality store.

The Perfect Day Tour of Marrakech. Our entire day with Youssef was wonderful. He and our driver picked us up from our hotel. My first impression was great. Youssef was dressed very professionally and spoke perfect English (he also speaks French, Arabic, and Japanese). We also had one more person on our trip with us, although Youssef asked our permission in advance. We spent the morning exploring the tombs, the palace, and the Jardin Majorelle. We were taken to a wonderful rooftop restaurant for lunch. It was overpriced and clearly catered to tourists; that being said, it was a lovely location and view, and I had the best kefta and harira of my entire trip here, so I had no regrets. Our afternoon consisted of exploring the souks and the Ben Youssef school. Youssef even bought us fresh-squeezed juice and lima beans to snack on. He helped us barter for items. I told him I wanted to buy saffron, and he bought be to a trusted shop (on request). He was incredibly knowledgeable, well-educated, and organized, yet flexible. 2 day trip to Marrakech and Essouira from Agadir. We went to Agadir for a week and had decided before we went that we would not go to Marrakech as we knew it was a good distance and we wanted to rest. When we arrived, our tour operator was offering a 2 day trip with Sahara Tours and we couldn't resist as we knew that the thing not to miss in Marrakech was night time in Jemaa el Fna square which the overnight would allow.Make no mistake, this is a long trip - but we were thrilled we did it. We set off at 7 a.m. on the coast road to Essouira - a rough windy road over the Atlas mountains and along wonderful surfing beaches - arriving in Essouira around 11. 30 a.m. It was very windy (almost cold!) which is the norm here (hence the surfing). It is a wonderful town and it feels like it is unchanged for hundreds of years - thankfully globalisation has not yet reached here! As we wandered around the town - basically a large souk - local rushed past with their carts full of their business wares and we felt like intruders in a life that has been going on quite well without us for aeons. After lunching on fresh fish, we continued the remaining 170kms to Marrakech, arriving as the sun set. We went by horse drawn carriage to our dinner venue - an amazingly ornate interior where we had delicious tagines and couscous - as much as we wanted and served by friendly staff - after which there was traditional entertainment. We went on from here to Jemaa el Fna where the entertainment was amazing - sights, sounds, smells, colours - and crowds of people. Every form of entertainment was there from snake charmers to the barbary apes, dancers, berber water carriers etc. You need a stern constitution to ensure that you are not taken for a ride and you need to be very firm as you will be plagued if you give in just a little!!The next morning we visited the Majorelle Gardens which were restored by Yves St. Laurent and which are small but beautiful. After that, we returned to the souk - a maze in which it is a delight to get lost - where we were first given a tour and then were left to our own devices for adventures! It was 43C when we were there so the fresh squeezed orange juice in the square was welcome at 40 cent for a large glass.Our overnight hotel was fine - nothing special but perfectly adequate - and had a nice pool where we had a quick swim after a buffet lunch before our trip back to Agadir - this time on the new motorway, arriving at 6.30 p.m. very tired but very happy.

Great Tour Arranged for Us - we highly recommend!. We sourced Soul Adventure 4X4 Tours via Trip Advisor and decided this was the way to see Morocco – and we were not disappointed. But also many highlights and great experiences so hard to decide what we may have amended. Definitely the night in the Berber camp at Merzourga was a highlight, amidst the spectacular red dunes of the Sahara, stunning clear sky and lots of fun for the kids. But the other places each had something to offer the tourist. My most nervous part of booking the tour was sending the deposit! Always a bit worrying sending money to an organization you don’t know, and we elected to use a bank transfer over Western Union (the latter which is easier for Soul Adventure I think). We paid a 10% deposit and the balance on arrival, and I am pleased to report my caution was not required as everyone and everything was as arranged prior. I can also report Said is also utterly and completely honest – twice we amended or changed hotel arrangements and twice he ensured we received the refund of any difference quickly (aside from loaning me cash when we ran out of ATMs one day!).So I would completely recommend Soul Adventures for your Morocco Tour and would happily respond to any queries or questions. The tour was easily arranged, priced very competitively and performed professionally throughout. As a family we loved it and had a wonderful trip with Said.Finally – we travelled completely during Ramadan which did have some impact but much smaller than we had expected. No trouble eating food and drinking in public at all, and most restaurants are open for tourists. We had one day in a more remote village where one place was closed, but Said found a second restaurant which was able to serve lunch. That was the only time over 2 weeks. Of course we also had to be a little flexible with Said, given he was fasting all day, allowing a later start time and a rest during the heat of the day. But there are far less tourists than usual and most Riads were not busy at all (choice of rooms). So overall there are no issues travelling during this time if you have to (for us it was dictated by school break).Go ahead and book with faith in these guys!

We loved Morocco. I do not think words can make these guys justice. The driver is what makes or breaks the trip, in my case the driver Youssef made it. It was my wife & I on our honeymoon, we went to Spain then by ship to Morocco, the driver picked us up on time from the port, drove us to all the places we asked him for, we even needed to try things outside of our agreed upon trip (a Moroccan bath which I recommend anyone to ask for that in their trip) and he spent the extra time & effort to find us one of the quality hammams (tourists baths as they call them), we were even a bit picky on the food, and the driver accommodated all of our requests and took us to the right places (restaurants) to try the types of food we were craving. The hotels were so unique and awesome. He even helped us with bargaining with the locals at the market for the shopping we did. The other tour guides (because in the old parts of the cities we visited (Fes & Meknes), the company hired a dedicated tour guide and they were very friendly and knowledgable. Also the driver has the advantage of speaking the 2 main languages spoken in Morocco which is Arabic & Amazighi and his English was really good. I highly recommend this Soul Adventures and their private tours. And just to be fair the owner/manager of the company used to call the driver a few times a day to follow up on us and spoke with me a couple of times to check on us and make sure everything is ok and all is according to the plan.Now as for Morocco, it is a beautiful country, we only had 5 days to spend in Morocco but I wish we had more time to see more, the hotels we stayed at the majority of times were called (Riyad) and the manegers/owners of these Riyads were very friendly people, I remember there was a wedding in Meknes after midnight and I really wanted to see it, so the owner of that Riyad opened the door for me and let me record the wedding and watch the locals dancing in colourful clothing, was beautiful. I even wanted to try McDonald's while we were there and they sent their driver to get us a meal (we paid extra obviously but they were very accommodating).Just a general tip if you are going to Morocco:1. If you agree on paying by euros, make sure you bring euros with you. Same if you agree on US dollars then bring US dollars with you. I am from Canada and I did not bring Euros with me (which was a mistake) because the local exchange rates are different from the international rates. And on that note, Morocco is a very safe country, the people are not wealthy yet very friendly. And the driver is super trustworthy, he helped me many times in finding local currency exchanges to pay for things, I even made a mistake and paid him extra one time, and he corrected me and paid me back and that was very honest and kind of you, he really deserved every euro of tip I gave him.2. Cellular internet is not the best in Morocco (I mean the data on mobile phones) but at all the hotels they was wifi connections and it worked so that was good.That's it really, again, thank you Said from Soul Adventures and I look forward to coming to Morocco again for another trip (hopefully soon).

Seven stars! See Berber Morocco!. This small, family-run tour company is the best! From the beginning they were extremely responsive and helpful, starting with the planning of the trip and continuing all the way to the end. With e-mails flying back and forth, Said took our rather vague preferences (we want to stay in riads and auberges and do a lot of walking… Oh, and also, not too many day in cities…and we are interested in local food) and constructed a wonderful personalized 10 day tour of (mostly) Berber Morocco that was perfect for us. Their choices of "riads and auberges" for us to stay in were outstanding, truly Moroccan places of various kinds that pleased us immensely. Many were so out-of-the-way that we would never have found them on our own. They ranged from rather simple kasbahs to former palaces (one was even in a beautiful building parts of which dated to 1378!) but all were very clean and comfortable and every single one had friendly and welcoming management. Most were locally owned and operated, which I appreciate, both because I like to meet local people and because I prefer to spend my tourist dollars where they will benefit the local economy. Mohamed was a truly excellent driver--the best I've had in this kind of tour. I always felt completely safe whether we were moving at high speed on the highway, threading our way through chaotic city streets, or bumping down a rocky 4-wheel drive track leading to a nomad family camp. Said was with us too, and together the two of them took perfect care of us. They were friendly and good company, and showed us many facets of Morocco we would not have found on our own. They arranged local food (wonderful) for us and sought out local markets to show us. I was especially grateful for Said's help with bargaining; I always felt he was on our side in all transactions. Finally, the local guides they found and recommended for the cities and historical sites were always excellent. Overall, I can't think of a thing I would complain about.  I highly recommend SoulAdventure4x4 for your trip to Morocco -- Their prices were far lower than comparable tours arranged by USA or European travel companies and you will get a much better, more personalized experience.

MANY MANY THANKS AND INSHALLAH SEE YOU NEXT YEAR.. I have just travelled yet again with six friends (f) in two 4 x 4 in Morocco, yet again with Mohamed and Brahim as our guides/chauffeurs. It was life made easy without ever losing the feeling of adventure. However, of course they can’t do the impossible and it was on occasion very cold in the little local auberges (whch one would never find on one’s own) and on occasion there was no hot water .... but if you choose to travel into the interior, on little routes not even marked on the map, to areas of extraordinary beauty which the majority of travellers will never see, you accept in advance that there will be moments of questionable comfort. If you don’t have a spirit of adventure and a very open mind you will not have embarked on this sort of journey. The scenery is breathtaking, ever-changing, fabulous .... I run out of adjectives! We each took over 500 photos. Mohamed speaks excellent Spanish and his English gets ever better, especially after being with us for ten days! They both know some words of Dutch and German as well as Swedish now. Brahim speaks very good French, and of course both speak Arabic and Berber.I find them both very attentive and caring, whether you are the youngest in the group (-40) or the oldest (myself – 80). I cannot recommend them highly enough, and by writing this for Trip Advisor I want yet agaIn to say MANY MANY THANKS AND INSHALLAH SEE YOU NEXT YEAR.

Fantastic tour guides. My boyfriend and I just got back from a week in Morocco, and just to hit the punchline up front - we could not possibly imagine having enjoyed our trip without Lahcen, Said, and Mohammed, who together run Soul Adventure 4x4. Look no further for a guide – it’s easy to be skeptical of these Tripadvisor posts but trust us when we say that these guys made our trip; they were easy to communicate with in advance, planned a fantastic trip, but most of all, were incredibly genuine, good people, and we left feeling as if we’d made good friends in Morocco.We’d done an exhaustive amount of research before leaving New York for our trip, both on TripAdvisor and elsewhere, for the right guide, since we had a pretty specific idea of what we were looking for. Said was impressively responsive on email, and understood our needs and was accommodating in arranging the trip, and also made very helpful suggestions. Lahcen (who speaks five languages, including perfect English and French, among other things) was there waiting for us in Fez to start our trip, exactly as we had arranged, and ended up being a fantastic guide. They even welcomed us into their home on the drive out into the desert, where we had tea with their family, getting a true genuine experience.They arranged for a great night out in the desert (was just the two of us and our guide) and then we had a very easy drive back, spending the night in Ouarzazate, and then ending in Marrakech. To top it all off, Lahcen, who also happened to still be in Marrakech, even insisted on meeting us a day after our tour had ended to drive us to the airport from our riad in Marrakech.All in all, we can’t speak highly enough of the team – we highly recommend Soul Adventure 4x4!

A touch of the real Morocco. We arranged for a private tour from Marrakech through the Atlas Mountains, Ouarzazate, Tenehir and Merzouga with Soul Adventure 4X4. The price for a guide and private 4x4 was excellent. We were treated like guests and not like tourists. For those who want to see Morocco beyond the what t typical tourist company can arrange, I highly recommend this company.

Memorable, exotic vacation!. My husband , 3 kids and I chose Morocco for a family vacation this year. I was not very involved in the planning of the trip, as my husband did all of the research and found Soul Adventure 4x4 through Trip Advisor. Said and Lahcens friendly faces greeted us at the airport and our adventure began. We toured many cities and covered very diverse terrain including the magnificent atlas mountains. They were so accommodating and thoughtful and quickly became part of our family. I will always remember this vacation for the wonderful time we shared as a family , and for Said and Lachen's role in all of it!

exquisite trip with Said who took us to blend it with the locals. My husband and I recently visited Morocco and experienced the best vacation ever! i want to share my favorite part of our trip with anyone who is looking forward at visiting Morocco. my favorite destination was the desert of Merzouga, so here is what we experienced :After a peaceful night of sleep we departed with Said in his 4x4 to visit the local villages. In the village of Khamlia we watched the traditional dances and music of Gnawa. We visited bazaars and bought ourselves turbans to prepare for our afternoon camel trek into the dunes. For lunch Said took us to his family’s home where we enjoyed a delicious homemade traditional dish of Kalia and tea made by his grandmother. After two hours of camel trekking into the highest dunes in the world we arrived at the oasis which is located bellow one of the highest dunes of the desert. We enjoyed a cup of tea while meeting other tourists from around the world. Dinner is prepared by the camel men that led us to the oasis. After dinner we enjoyed the dances and the music of the drums played the same men who cooked our meal. These camel men are truly amazing, they speak many languages, trek us through the dunes, cook our meals, entertain us with dancing and music, tell jokes and fix your turban! Very hospitable. Before we retired in our Berber tent for the evening we walked through dunes, enjoyed the stars and listened to the camels chewing. We awoke early the next morning to enjoy the sunrise over the dunes. It is amazing how the sand dunes changes color from beige to a yellow orange color during this time. After this we camel trekked back to the Kasbah for showers and breakfast. It was now time to say goodbye to Merzouga. If you ever plan on visiting Morocco, Merzouga is a must see. Our tour guide, Said, was one of the best guides I have ever had the privilege of dealing with, he was knowledgeable about all the destinations we visited, humorous and very gracious. Soul Adventure 4x4 made this trip absolutely enjoyable by making it completely carefree. My husband and I will definitely return to this beautiful country to experience more of what it has to offer and we will definitely use the same excursion company.

“Highly recommended....”. I communicated with Lahcen before flying out of Canada to Morocco and we finally touched bases in Marrakech... Mohammed, our guide/driver picked us up and we were very lucky to have a very good car only to ourselves... it was really a private tour...I don't want to bore anyone with the details... if you want you can email me and I'll tell you all about it...just in a nutshell... Mohammed was awesome! He showed us everything there is to be seen... even adjusted the itinerary (even though it meant more intensive driving for him) to make ensure that we can catch our train back to Casa in time... amazing guy... he's given us so many good memories to reflect on... the camel ride, the night in the desert, Todra gorges, and the beautiful beautiful Atlas mountain...funny story: he came a couple of days before the tour to collect a deposit... and being the North American-raised that we are, we were hesitant to give cash away to a stranger... and so we had this long long conversation... and how quickly within 2 days he turned out to be one of the man we will always remember Morocco by!overall we highly recommend "souladventure" if you are going down there...

Amazing trip!. Ibra and Ali made our trip to Morocco incredible! Cannot recommend enough!

Excellent planning and organizing. Rachid and his team of very responsible and helpful employees took me and my 10 friends through 3 days in the Atlas Mountains. The perfect guide. We had the most fantastic tour with Rachid. He is kind, expirenced, and very save to hike with. We got very nice food and we really got value for money. We went for a 3 days hike ending by climming the Toubkal. I was just perfect.

Jbel Toubkal- Highlight of my time in Morocco. I booked a three day trek up Toubkal thinking just to escape the hustle and bustle of Marrakech for a few days. Prior to arriving to Marrakech, Rachid was very communicative about pricing and what would be included in the trip. He provided responses to my email within a day usually, making it easy to plan ahead. On the first day, I was greeted by a cab driver at my riad and driven up to Imlil, where I met my guide Rachid (not the owner and organizer) and started the trek up. I found the first day to be quite arduous: having not acclimated at all and having the travel catch up to me, I had to take it pretty slow. Rachid was great and allowed for many breaks and even cooked me lunch! The hike up the second day from the refuge was similarly difficult but absolutely stunning and worth all of the sweat and achy legs.My guide Rachid was the highlight of my trip-- he spoke English well and we switched between Spanish occasionally for the fun of it. The way up Toubkal is fairly straight forward, but I wouldn't have made it up without him. I highly recommend doing the trek in the winter when there is snow-- the mountain is stunning.

A full service guided tour and fantastic nature and moutain views. I went with 10 friends on a 3 day trip in the Atlas Mountain.The highlight was the view from 4167 meters at the top of Mount Toupkal.Atlas Mountain Guide had arranged pickup directly from the airport, food and lodging in the mountain area and mules to transport our luggage.We just had to concentrate on enjoying the trekking. We needed crampons to climb Mount Toupkal, and they were delivered at night from a village 4 hours ‘away, so that we could get safely to the mountain top and back.We were really impressed.

Fantastic experience with excellent guide. Our amazing trek to the top of Mt Toubkal would never had been the same without Rachid, our extremely professional, friendly and considerate guide. He not only led us on the right path and set the right pace so all of us (a group of 11 men in their 50's) made it to the peak. But he also provided the perfect and authentic moroccan experience with great local food and hospitality. Rachid is also very observant and helpful and immediately came to assistance if some of us needed help with a difficult passage or a loose steigeisen. With the extremely professional guide Rachid, you can rest assured that you are in good hands: just leave all the difficult decisions to him and enjoy the breathtaking views in the Atlas mountains!Before the trip we wondered if the full package with guide, mules, cook etc would make the trip too easy and less challenging for us, who are relatively experienced trekkers. But it turned out to be a very good decision instead of going on our own. First, we saved a lot of time not getting lost since the the path could sometimes be difficult to follow and was not marked correctly on the map. Second, even though we might have made it carrying our own backpacks, it made the trip much more enjoyable to load them on the mules - and it was still a challenge to make the ascend in thin air and keep control of our steps during the descend. Third, the local and freshly made food we were served was much better and more authentic than anything we could have prepared ourselves. And forth, it was a great relief to know that if anything went wrong, Rachid would know how to handle the situation and bring everybody home safely.So we strongly recommend that you choose Rachid and Atlas Mountains Guide for your trek in the Atlas Mountains!

Great Time in the Atlas. My wife and I did a 5 day ski tour with Atlas Mountain Guides. I have nothing but good things to say about them. Ski Hiking in the Atlas Mountains. Awesome organisation of our one-week-ski-hiking-trip in the Atlas mountains!An "all-inclusive" trip close to nature and friendly guides!I can absolutely recommend Rachid and his crew to anyone!!!

Conquering the highest peak in North Africa with a new friend. :-). With the help of Rashid, a really great guide (!), I managed to concquer the highest peak in Northtern Africa (4167)... He will keep you safe.I'd recommend Rashid for any tours what so ever.

Day tour to Atlas Mountains. We are staying at the Riad Dar Anika. I will write another review for the Riad (it is wonderful). The manager Antonio arranged for us to go on a day tour to the Atlas Mountains. It was the most wonderful day and experience. We left at 9am, collected by our driver Jawad who was delightful. He speaks very good English and was an extremely good driver (very important, going up the mountain). We drove for about an hour and a half and then he picked up our guide Hassam and then dropped us all off after 5 mins to start our walk. We walked for about 2 hours. Hassam is a lovely chap. Speaks very good English. We had fun and joked with him. We walked to the waterfall and then carried on. Hassam is very good at assessing how well you walk and will adjust the walk to suit the person. Don't be worried if you can't walk for 2 hours and miss out on this trip as it can suit everyone. We had lunch at Hassam's house. It was a fantastic lunch with so much food and his mother cooked it. She even made a birthday cake for my husband as it was his birthday (the Riad must have told Hassam). The little children from the village came in and had some cake. They were very sweet and it was great to see them. We walked for about 10 mins after lunch and Jawad brought us back. We arrived back at 4.30pm. It was wonderful to leave the city behind for a day and see nature and how people live a stress free life!

A fantastic full day trip in the Atlas Mountains with Get Your Guide Tours.. We had a wonderful day trip through the Atlas Mountains. We were picked up at our hotel on the outskirts of Marrakech and driven in a 4 wheel vehicle through the 3 sections of the mountains .We stopped at a Berber village and were shown lots of herbs and spices being grown .along with medicinal and beauty products ,oils etc.We then visited a shop making and selling ,Table Linen ,Rugs ,Scarves etc .We walked up to the top of a waterfall ,drove past the man made lake .We stopped for traditional lunch in a Berber house on the top of a mountain range . We sat outside with views to die for and ate Veg soup and Meat and Veg Tagines .

Amazing trip with quality service. I was able to book an Atlas mountain hike with Aztat with relatively short notice. Best day of the holiday . Couple of things I would say to start is 1.) bring comfortable walking/hiking shoes 2.) bring a bottle of water 3.) a good camera 4.) use a guideThe drives about 1-1 1/2 half hours from Marrakech, but it's well worth it. Our riad told us just to go to eureka valley only instead of all three valleys which would of taken up more of the day.You do the usual stopping at places so they can sell you goods but we had a private guide so we asked him after the first to just go to the mountains which he was happy to do. Once we got there he advised us to use a guide, so we did (200 dirams) your then taken up a tough route up the mountain that is physically tough especially if you don't have suitable footwear. We only went as far as the first three waterfalls but that in itself was really high. The views are amazing and the trip all in all was good fun. Throughout the mountain there are Berber people with their shops and it's always nice to have a good haggle.It's a must do for Marrakech
best day. Wow what an experience, we went to atlas mountains to see water falls. Long day but well worth it,views from top are breath taking
Atlas Mountains. Amazing day out! Definitely recommend this trip! It's a great way to get new experiences, really enjoyed it when I went in October!

Amazing climb, gorgeous views - and no health and safety!. We walked with a guide from the village of Setti Fatima up the mountains to see some waterfalls. Our guide was excellent and enabled us to complete a climb that I would never normally have been able to achieve. Basically, it was a hair-raising climb up slippery rocks that would probably be closed to the public in the UK. Our guide asked us before we set off if anyone had asthma, but didn't ask if we were generally fit. One of our party had to step out a third of the way up due to the steepness and scariness of the climb. At one stage we were faced with a vertical mossy rock with water trickling down it and given a rusty ladder to get up with. Our guide was there to hold our hand every step of the way and we all accomplished it fine. The final views were spectacular and the sense of achievement well worth it. We took an easier way down and were then taken to the guide's home for a traditional berber meal (we had arranged this in advance via our hotel the day before). All in all a fantastic day out. You just need to be fit enough to enjoy it.

Amazing!. I had a great time at the 5-Trek to Toubkal Mountain with our guide Rachid. The landscape was really beautiful and it was a good experience to sleep in Berber villages. Rachid is a really helpful and well-organized guide and his team, too.I highly recommend him as a guide to go in the High Atlas!!!

Beautiful experience. Scary, slippery but worth it. Climbed very high with our lovely guide Muktar. Mountains surround by a lovely village of 400 Berbers. We even went into a Berbers house, visited the family and were shown around. An overall amazing day out!!

2 days Toukbal climb. We climbed toukbal with Rachid Aztat on sept 12 2015. We found him trough online research Rachid is pretty much a one man company with all the resources available to arrange and customize any trip. He was very professional, honest and he has great knowledge of the region and the berber culture. He setup a great pace during our climb with plenty of rest stops and great food But hikers need to be in good shape. Our summit day was a 12hr hike day. I got Altitude Sickness near the summit and thanks to Rachid I was able to complete my climb safely.

Toubkal ascent 2 days. A few days ago we hiked to the summit of Mt. Toubkal in two days. The surroundings are simply beautiful and we had an amazing time! We think this will make the hike more pleasant and balanced.Overall, we would highly recommend Rachid and his team as your guide in the Atlas mountains. Visited in September 2015

Amazing trekking to the second highest mountain in North Africa .. M'Goun!. We wanted to see the Ait Bouguemez valley, the top of M'Goun mountain and the Valley of Roses. We had 6 days (departing from and arriving back in Marrakech). Rachid made it happen (as it appeared later on that this is an ambitious schedule, with long days of walking (longest day: 32km, including the top) and one day walking through the river :-) )! Rachid was very helpful in answering questions through e-mail. He picked us up at the airport. We had the choice of booking a Riad ourselves, or on his services. Rachid is also very flexible in terms of changing the program, as the flight of some of my friends was cancelled, so we were only able to leave Marrakech 6 hours later than planned.Rachid arranged another guide for us because of his own agenda (I think). Guide Oulaid is very friendly, learned us about local culture (he originates from the Ait Bouguemez Valley or 'Happy Valley'), and set the right pace for the whole group (7 people), what really created a good team spirit.The guide, the cook (who was very attentive to my vegetarianism), and 4 others (with each of them a mule), created a fantastic experience! Although we only shared a similar language with Oulaid, the whole group was very friendly, and we had a good time in the evening, eating together, we once played the cards, and we sang songs and played music together for several times!They can support their village in the valley (schools, ..) because of our support.

great views. the guide was really good and knowledgeable, stopping to look at local works of art and pottery. stopping to look at the views, we experienced the Berbers making mint tea and fresh bread. lunch was traditional tagine good, although drinks should be all In as well!! long day spent travelling and where they say they have nothing there was running water, flushing toilet and satellite dishes almost everywhere! would recommend this trip but not for young kids.

Amazing 2 day trek to summit of mount Toubkal with Rachid. We has such a great time on our Amazing 2 day trek to the summit of mount Toubkal with Rachid who organised everything for us. A 'day' 'high' in the 'summit 'near the sky.. Go, you can't miss this. We did 2 tours, the 4x4 tour and a coach tour to the mountains and waterfalls. The Cascades waterfall is amazing and truly stunning. Plenty of water even in August. Amazing trip in atlas mountains and desert. Rashid was an amazing guide in the atlas mountains for our summit of Jebel Toubkal. He also organized a one night desert excursion and hosted us at his family hotel for one night. Great service, food and insight into the Burbur lifestyle

Spontaneous Toubkal trek. Atlas Mountain Tour. Before we got Marrakech my friend had read about a guy called Adil who does trips to the mountains and who has been recommended on here. We found his number and called him from our hotel. He had availability for the next day and was told that his colleague would meet at our hotel. He also sent us a email confirming the itinerary for the day and prices.Azaz arrived and picked us up in a 4x4, this was a one on one tour with me, my friend and Azaz the tour guide. From the start of the tour Azaz explained about the mountains and the Berber Villages. We stopped of at a museum about the Berber Villages and their history. Next we took a drive to an Argan Oil factory to been shown how it is made. The last stop was lunch at a Berber Village in someone's house, we were welcomed and felt humbled to be in their home. We were given lunch which was freshly cooked which included chicken tagine, couscous, salad, bread and water plus mint tea.Before we had left we had read that the villages are poor and that if possible to take sweets and pencils for the children. We took some sweets and and pencils and gave them out to the children. Our tour guide Azaz was very knowledgable and was willing to stop if we wanted to take a photo and didn't rush us at all. We spent the whole day out and got dropped back to our hotel.This tour might be slightly expensive however it was 100% worth it we had a one on one tour of the mountains, history of the mountains and lunch.I recommend speaking to Adil of 4x4camel.
Stunning. Views are stunning, the people are lovely we had lunch in a family home which was really tasty. Make sure you have comfortable footwear we had a 10k walk. Highly recommended

Toubkal, Desert, and Imperial Cities. We did a 12 day tour with Atlas Mountain Guide including 4 days trekking Toubkal, 4 days of deserts and gorges, and 4 days of imperial cities. 4 day/3 night trek to Jebel Toubkal. Would highly recommend Rachid Aztat as your guide to summit Toubkal. We were picked up at our hotel in Marrakech & from then on, had a lovely time. We stayed in great refuges and if you can, ask Rachid to bring Ibrahim as the cook because that man can do amazing things at over 2000meters!! Beautiful food, nearly too much to be honest!! No fear of any weight loss on this trip! There was really nothing to fault about Rachid so if you want a hassle free, reliable & well priced service, pick Rachid!

Fantastic Trek to Mount Toubkal with a Fanstatic Guide, Rachid and a Fabulous Cook, Ibrahim!!!. Trekking to Mount Toubkal - We began our trip by being collected at our hotel in Marrakech by taxi. We were brought to just outside Imlil were we met Rachid (our guide) and Ibrahim (our cook). We had forgotten to order sleeping bags for hire but this was not a problem, Rachid contacted someone in Imlil and they dropped the sleeping bags off to us before we left. The sleeping bags were really good quality and very clean.... it saved us bringing them on our flight.....On the first day we trekked for about 5 hours with lunch in between.... Rachid answered any questions we had about the culture and location we were at .... the food was absolutlety fabulous.... very Moroccan and very wholesome food. We trekked through some Berber villiages and ended up at a refuge in one of them.The accomodation was basic (which is to be expected) but very clean with a toilet and hot shower and you could charge all your electronic stuff.... the food again was really good. Rachid brought us for a walk before dinner and answered any questions we had. The next day we had planned to trek up to 2700M but as I wasnt feeling well we went up to 2200 and trekked for about 5 hours again through some lovely villages and ended up at 2250m at the Tamsolt refuge. And as I wasnt feeling well Rachid called Ibrahim, the cook and told him so he made some rice for me and gave me a local remedy to drink. This was extemely thoughful of them to think of me. Again the refuge at Tamsolt was fantastic, toilet, hot water, electricity etc and very clean. On the third day we headed off at 7.30am as this was going to be a strenuous day.... it was the hardest day as we went from 2250m up to 3600m, but the views and scenary were amazing, we passed a fab waterfall that day too... also it was so quiet and not like other treks were you meet alot of trekkers... there was a little snow at 3600m. We got a packed lunch that day, which was lovely and very sufficient and then headed to base camp which was at approx 3207m. This was another lovely refuge. It was very busy so we had to share a dorm. There was 16 people in it but as it was only for one night it was fine. Food again was fab, we got homemade chips, which was such a treat........ The last day we headed off at 6am to the summit ... it was a hard enough trek but very enjoyable, met loads of lovely people. We made it to 4167m. The last day was very long, 9 hours walking. We walked all the way down to Imlil via a different route. This is another way people trek to Mount Toubkal but I would recommend the trek we did as the scenary is much nicer. If you come from Imlil you walk through a valley the whole time which makes it a very boring trek .... Rachid then arranged for a taxi back to Marrakech for us ... we arrived back to Marrakech by 5.30pm.The guide we had and the cook made our trip.... they were so helpful with everything, even when I wasnt well they looked after me and on the last day Rachid gave me a lend of his walking poles as there was some snow.....You need to have a level of fitness for this trek if you want to enjoy it, there are parts that a physically tough enough and a good pair of hiking boots are definately required..... I would highly recommend Atlas Mountains Guide, Rachid and Ibrahim to take you on this stunning Trek through the Atlas Mountains :-)

Atlas foothills. EPIC! Do it, what a fantastic trip with Dunes line tours. We stopped on the way at a Berber workshop making argon oil and all the associated products and it was fantastic. We travelled up the valley and where dropped off to walk up to the waterfalls,it was beautifully mad with restaurants hanging on to the rocks over the river, absolutely amazing.

Mind-blowing experience. Fascinating scenery, very kind people and an interesting culture and lifestyle.. You have got a lot to explore in Atlas Mountains and the villages in the area.. Amazing Berber village trek and Mt Toubkal!. I am just back from an amazing 4 day hike to the summit of Mt Toubkal with 3 of my friends! I would highly recommend Rachid and his tour company for any treks in the atlas mountain area!

Incredible 4 day hike to Mt Toubkal!. I seriously couldn't recommend Rachid more. I went on a 4 day hike through the Atlas Mountains, with three of my friends -all girls! We really didn't see any other tourists until the third day when we arrived at the Toubkal refuges. All accommodation was excellent for hiking standards, in my opinion! Food was delicious! If you are climbing Toubkal I would suggest doing a few extra days, instead of doing the direct up and down the same route which most people seem to do. However, Rachid would also be excellent to take on day hikes or other routes! Prices are definitely reasonable too - as there is no outside companies getting commission. We definitely had a trip full of memorable experiences all thanks to Rachid and his team.

Three days hiking was a pleasure with this great guide.. These checkpoints were not a problem at all with Iddir, but if our group had tried to rent a car and drive around Morocco ourselves, it would have been very stressful and maybe impossible.* Iddir was mindful of regularly stopping for bathroom breaks, making sure we had enough water, and ensuring we stopped at photogenic spots so we could take lots of photos :)* Along the way, Iddir also taught us about Morocco's history and culture, and was a generally cheerful and enthusiastic guide for the entire week, despite being stuck with the nine of us!* The drive between some points (e.g. Merzouga to Fes) can be quite long. Again, I don't want to ruin any surprises :)* The Medina in Fes has some fascinating history, and the local guide Iddir found for us was very friendly and informative.* At the end of our trip, we decided that we wanted to add Essaouira to our itinerary, and asked Iddir and the driver if they would be willing to extend the trip. You're going to leave with a trove of unbelievable photos.GROUP SIZE* Iddir mentioned that he has had groups large and small (from solo travelers to groups with 50+ people). For our group of 9 people, we used a large van to drive around Morocco, but with a smaller group Iddir said he uses a 4x4.
